subject: statistics
title: Logistic Regression Formula
contentHtml: The logistic regression formula is a cornerstone of binary classification in machine learning.

workedExample.problemHtml: Suppose we want to predict whether a customer will purchase a product based on their age.

steps.description: Plug in the values of x and the coefficients
steps.explanation: We're using the customer's age as our feature, which is represented by x.

intuition: This formula gives us the probability of a positive outcome (purchase) given the input features.

subject: statistics
title: Logistic Regression Formula
contentHtml:
Logistic regression is a fundamental concept in machine learning and statistics.

This formula provides the probability of a positive outcome given the input features.

workedExample.problemHtml: Given a dataset with features X and binary target y, calculate the probability of y=1 given X.

steps.description: Calculate the dot product Z = w^T * X
steps.explanation: This is the weighted sum of input features.

intuition: Logistic regression provides a way to model binary classification problems by mapping the input features to a probability between 0 and 1.

subject: statistics
title: Logistic Regression Formula
contentHtml: Logistic regression is a fundamental technique in machine learning and statistics for binary classification problems.

workedExample.problemHtml: Suppose we want to predict whether a customer will purchase a product based on their age and income.

steps.explanation: We combine the input features using the learned coefficients.

intuition: This formula represents the probability of a positive outcome (purchase) given the input features. The sigmoid function maps any real-valued number to a value between 0 and 1, making it suitable for binary classification.
